Directions: Read the poem, then answer each question that follows.
Context: This poem expresses how the speaker faces frightening experiences.
Title: Life Doesn't Frighten Me
Author: by Maya Angelou
Content: Life doesn't frighten me at all
Life doesn't frighten me at all.
They don't frighten me at all
That doesn't frighten me at all.
Life doesn't frighten me at all.
Life doesn't frighten me at all.\n
No, they don't frighten me at all.
They don't frighten me at all.
Don't show me frogs and snakes
That I keep up my sleeve,
I can walk the ocean floor
Life doesn't frighten me at all
Life doesn't frighten me at all.
